items.title: lammps: Install vim and neovim files & cuda support

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Before change, without extendModules:

nix-repl> :p (lib.nixosSystem { modules = [ { nixpkgs.hostPlatform = "x86_64-linux"; boot.loader.grub.enable = false; boot.initrd.enable = false; } ]; }).pkgs.nixos-rebuild  
«derivation /nix/store/30hqx7sxjia00mm1imdwz848gjy142s8-nixos-rebuild.drv»

Before change, with extendModules:

nix-repl> :p ((lib.nixosSystem { modules = [ { nixpkgs.hostPlatform = "x86_64-linux"; boot.loader.grub.enable = false; boot.initrd.enable = false; } ]; }).extendModules { modules = []; }).pkgs.nixos-rebuild                                
error: attribute 'pkgs' missing

       at «string»:1:1:

            1| ((lib.nixosSystem { modules = [ { nixpkgs.hostPlatform = "x86_64-linux"; boot.loader.grub.enable = false; boot.initrd.enable = false; } ]; }).extendModules { modules = []; }).pkgs.nixos-rebuild

After change, with extendModules:

nix-repl> :p ((lib.nixosSystem { modules = [ { nixpkgs.hostPlatform = "x86_64-linux"; boot.loader.grub.enable = false; boot.initrd.enable = false; } ]; }).extendModules { modules = []; }).pkgs.nixos-rebuild
«derivation /nix/store/30hqx7sxjia00mm1imdwz848gjy142s8-nixos-rebuild.drv»

Ping @Lassulus
items.title: nixos: make extendModules retain pkgs on nixos configs

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add nixos-rebuild repl, which loads a nix repl for you.

If you use flakes, brings the flake itself into scope as well.

Apologies to the non-flake users; your repl isn't quite as fancy, but at least evaluates your config exactly as you would expect, unlike flakes which are only evaluated impurely for now.

Tested by hand, as evaluating in the sandbox is tricky.

Try it

Flake in ~/config

nix run github:hercules-ci/nixpkgs/nixos-rebuild-repl#nixos-rebuild -- repl --flake ~/config

Non-flake

nix --extra-experimental-features flakes\ nix-command run github:hercules-ci/nixpkgs/nixos-rebuild-repl#nixos-rebuild -- repl

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This module ensures that we have a monado.service that has CAP_SYS_NICE to utilize asynchronous reprojection. (See #217119) for details about asynchronous reprojection)

This effectively shadows the unit files packaged in monado. Maybe it is desirable to remove those from the packages.

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add matchEdid option to autorandr. This flag allows autorandr to match displays based on edid instead of name. It is useful as the name of a display sometimes varies on different machines.

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This adds a NixOS module for Soft Serve, a tasty, self-hostable Git server for the command line.

The module has a test that checks some basic things like creating users, creating a repo and cloning it. Bash is required for running the hook scripts (e.g., on push), so I added it to the path of the wrapper.

items.content_html:
Bot-based backport to release-23.05, triggered by a label in #240082.

  • Before merging, ensure that this backport complies with the Criteria for Backporting.
    • Even as a non-commiter, if you find that it does not comply, leave a comment.
items.title: [Backport release-23.05] neovim: add perl to supported providers

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This is a NixOS module to enable "multiple bootloaders" at the same time.

They all will be installed one by one in the reverse order as they are specified to let users append new bootloaders from multiple locations.

The motivation is to build newer usecases for boot stories in NixOS.

TODO:

  • Assert there must be at least one bootloader enabled or container boot is enabled.
  • More asserts!
  • Add documentation on how to add a new bootloader in NixOS.
  • Ensure no "false positives" deprecation notices appears due to poking the structure.
  • Deprecate boot.loader.efi into boot.efi
  • Ensure containers works.
Things done

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add nixos module for unpackerr. Software is already in nixpkgs, just needed nixos config

Works for me, I left default user/group set to nobody/nogroup because this needs to run as the owner of archive files so there is no good default
